contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = Unicolored Jay | status = LC | status_system = IUCN3.1 | status_ref = <ref>{{IUCN|id=106005692 |title=''Aphelocoma unicolor'' | assessors=[[BirdLife International]] |version=2012.1 |year=2012 |accessdate=16 July 2012}}</ref> | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordata]] | classis = [[Aves]] | ordo = [[Passeriformes]] | familia = [[Corvidae]] | genus = ''[[Aphelocoma]]'' | species = '''''A. unicolor''''' | binomial = ''Aphelocoma unicolor'' | binomial_authority = ([[Bernard du Bus de Gisignies|Du Bus de Gisignies]], 1847) }} The '''Unicolored Jay''' (''Aphelocoma unicolor'' <ref> [[Etymology]]: ''Aphelocoma'', from [[Latin]]ized [[Ancient Greek]] ''apheles-'' (from ἀφελής-) "simple" + Latin ''coma'' (from Greek ''kome'' κόμη) "hair", in reference to the lack of striped or banded feathers in this genus, compared to other jays. ''unicolor'', [[Latin]] for "unicolored".</ref>) is an [[scrub jay|''Aphelocoma'']] jay native to [[cloud forest]]s of northwestern [[Central America]] and southern and southeastern [[Mexico]], from central [[Honduras]] west to central [[Guerrero]], southern [[Veracruz]] and extreme southern [[San Luis Potosi]]. It is apparently a [[Basal (phylogenetics)|basal]] member of its [[genus]] (Rice ''et al.'' 2003).<!-- See the RangeMap: "www.natureserve.org"-"Permanent Resident" category(map defines, northwest, central, etc.--> ==References== *Rice, Nathan H.; Martínez-Meyer, Enrique & Peterson, A. Townsend (2003): Ecological niche differentiation in the ''Aphelocoma'' jays: a phylogenetic perspective. ''[[Biological Journal of the Linnean Society|Biol. J. Linn. Soc.]]'' '''80'''(3): 369–383. <small>{{DOI|10.1046/j.1095-8312.2003.00242.x}}</small> [http://www.ansp.org/research/biodiv/ornithology/pdf/Jay-phylogeny.pdf PDF fulltext] ===Footnotes=== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[[CONABIO]]: [http://conabioweb.conabio.gob.mx/bancoimagenes/cgi-bin/ventanaImagen.pl?idimagen=9740 Unicolored Jay drawing]. Retrieved 2007-FEB-26. *[http://conabioweb.conabio.gob.mx/bancoimagenes/doctos/001_thumbs102-45.htm Article with Unicolored Jay] *[http://www.natureserve.org/infonatura/servlet/InfoNatura?sourceTemplate=Ltabular_report.wmt&loadTemplate=Ldetail_report.wmt&selectedReport=&summaryView=Ltabular_report.wmt&elKey=650028&paging=home&save=true&startIndex=1&nextStartIndex=1&reset=false&offPageSelectedElKey=650028&offPageSelectedElType=species&offPageYesNo=true&selectedIndexes=650028 RangeMaps & synopsis] InfoNatura NatureServe *[http://conabioweb.conabio.gob.mx/bancoimagenes/imagenes/thumbs/thumbs9740.jpg Picture]; [http://conabioweb.conabio.gob.mx/bancoimagenes/doctos/001_thumbs177-28.htm Article] *[http://vireo.acnatsci.org/search.html?Form=Search&SEARCHBY=Scientific&KEYWORDS=aphelocoma+unicolor&showwhat=images&AGE=All&SEX=All&ACT=All&Search=Search&VIEW=All&ORIENTATION=All&RESULTS=24 Unicolored Jay photo gallery] VIREO <!-- See the good RangeMap/maps, lists, etc at: "www.natureserve.org" ...shows only "Permanent Reseident" category--> {{Corvidae|3}} [[Category:Aphelocoma]] [[Category:Native birds of Southern Mexico|Jay, Unicolored]] [[Category:Birds of Mexico|Jay, Unicolored]] [[Category:Birds of El Salvador|Jay, Unicolored]] [[Category:Birds of Guatemala|Jay, Unicolored]] [[Category:Birds of Honduras|Jay, Unicolored]] {{Corvidae-stub}}
